summary: Gavriel Kahane: "We're really not challenging Barry Diller" Arkhouse disclosed a "significant" stake in IAC in April . The activist shop said IAC owns 40 publications such as People .  IAC's sales fell 9% year over year in the first quarter, but adjusted operating profits surged 166% . IAC ended the quarter with $1.2 billion in cash, a relatively high number when considering the company's market cap is $3 billion .  Arkhouse is no stranger to shaking prominent trees in corporate America . The firm took a highly publicized position in Macy's in December 2023 and offered to buy the retailer for $5.8 billion . Arkhouse's stake in MGM is valued at $2 billion .  Arkhouse and partner Brigade offered to purchase Macy's for a final price of $6.9 billion . Macy's executives rejected the offer, contending the consortium didn't have the financing in place . Today, Macy's market cap stands at $3.3 billion following a series of challenging quarters .  Brian Sozzi is Yahoo Finance's Executive Editor and Executive Editor at X@BrianSozzi,Instagram, andLinkedIn.com . He talks with the biggest names in business and markets onOpening Bid .

Citi Research more than doubled their 12-month price target on the stock to a Wall Street high Wednesday morning . Marquee partnerships, optimistic revenue outlook and a renewed enthusiasm for all things artificial intelligence have driven CoreWeave to all-time highs . Gains stretched into the fourth-consecutive session, to close at a record high .  CoreWeave’s first quarterly earnings report as a public company, which beat on revenue, should ease worries that demand was waning, analysts say . Bullish investors have been cheered by last Thursday's deal worth as much as $4 billion for the company to provide additional cloud computing capacity for OpenAI .  CoreWeave outlined plans to let customers use rival chips in data centers built around its technology . Eight of the analysts tracked by Bloomberg recommend holding the stock and two advise to sell . Bears point out earnings were mixed, the report had initially sent shares lower .  More than 40% of the stock’s float has been used to bet against shares, according to data from S3 Partners LLC. The stock also boasts high short interest . Citi reiterated their neutral rating while acknowledging some recent rally is justified .

Microsoft's digital crimes unit disrupted a prominent malware known as Lumma Stealer . The malware infected more than 394,000 Windows computers globally between March 16 and May 16 . Lumma helps users steal passwords, credit card information, bank accounts andcryptocurrency wallets .  The U.S. digital crimes unit to take down roughly 2,300 malicious domains . The Justice Department took over Lumma’s central command structure and “disrupted the marketplaces” where the malware is sold to cybercriminals, Microsoft said . Europol andJapan’�s Cybercrime Control Center also were involved .

Nearly 400,000 Windows computers globally infected by the information-stealing malware in the past two months . Lumma is capable of stealing data from various browsers and applications, such as cryptocurrency wallets, and installing other malware . Microsoft's Digital Crimes Unit filed a legal action against Lumma Stealer last week .  Microsoft: "For layered defenses and industry collaboration to counter threats" Microsoft said in a separate blog post on the malware. for layered defenses .

Microsoft's 2025 Build Conference highlighted the company’s growing focus on AI agents and developer tools . Analysts from Citi and Wolfe Research provided their thoughts on the event . Citi said little stood out as a near-term revenue accelerator .  Analysts said AI adoption has become “mandatory” and that “fears around ROI are shifting back to FOMO” Wolfe highlighted strong interest in new Copilot Studio capabilities and AI Foundry Local .

AdobeADBE shares have jumped 19% in a month . A pause in tariffs that reduced macroeconomic uncertainty also helped the stock . Adobe's near-term prospects remain challenging given stiff competition in the AI and GenAI space from the likes ofMicrosoftMSFT-backed OpenAI .  ADBE stock is trading at a premium with a forward 12-month price/sales of 7.28X compared with the broader Zacks Computer and Technology sector’s 6.14X . Microsoft, DocuSign and Alphabet shares returned 24.9%, 20.9% and 8.2% over the same period .  Adobe plans to invest in its sales capacity to deliver Adobe-wide offerings across business, education and government . The integration of AI Assistant in Acrobat, Reader and Express bodes well for Adobe’s prospects .  ADBE expects this AI book of business to double by the end of fiscal 2025 . For fiscal 2025, the Zacks Consensus Estimate for earnings is pegged at $20.36 per share, down by 5 cents over the past 60 days . The figure indicates 10.53% growth over fiscal 2024 .  Adobe’s modest near-term growth prospect and stretched valuation makes the stock unattractive for investors . ADBE currently has a Zacks Rank #4 (Sell), which implies that investors should avoid the stock for the time being . The stock is currently trading below the 200-day moving average indicating a bearish trend .  Alphabet Inc. (GOOGL) and Docusign (DOCU) are all listed in the same category . Alphabet Inc.'s parent company, Google, has been a top-ranked stock in the U.S. market for the year .

Microsoft’s finance department — which consists of roughly 5,000 people — has accelerated AI implementation efforts in recent years . “As Microsoft continues to grow and become more and more complex, we have no appetite right now to continue to grow our headcount at the same pace,” an executive says .  Microsoft’s digital transformation effort “has been accelerated at breakneck pace in the past two years,” Hrncirik said . The push comes as Microsoft is also locked in a race with other big tech companies to dominate the AI market .  Microsoft expects to spend roughly $80 billion on AI-enabled data centers during the current fiscal year . Copilot for Finance, a feature in Microsoft 365 apps such as Excel, Outlook and Teams, introduced last fall .  Headcount reductions likely to be largest since Microsoft laid off 10,000 employees in 2023, report says . Microsoft finance chief says he has no insight into whether headcount reductions at Microsoft might impact finance team .

Stocks are lower at midday, putting in jeopardy the six-day winning streak for the S&P 500 . Investors are awaiting earnings reports from major retailers such as Target, Lowe's, and TJX .  Intel has considered divesting its network and edge businesses as the company looks to cut parts of the company its new CEO does not see as crucial . Levi Strauss announced a deal to sell the Dockers brand to Authentic Brands Group Amer Sports boosted its adjusted profit forecast for the full year .  An internal Google document reveals that the company considered giving publishers more control over how their content is used to trainAImodels, but ultimately chose not to . Builder.ai, a U.K. technology start-up backed by Microsoft, is entering bankruptcy proceedings after admitting “problems” under its past leadership . General Motors has halted exports of a small number of U.S.-made vehicles to China due to tariffs .  The Dow was down 0.24%, or 103.03, to 42,689.04, and the Nasdaq was down 87.41, to 19,128.05 . Trip.com(TCOM) reported Q1 results, with CEO Jane Sun commenting, “The travel industry maintained strong momentum in the first quarter of 2025, supported by resilient consumer demand and favorable travel policies”  The 500 was down 0.36%, or 21.50, to 5,942.10 . The S&P 500 fell 21.36% or 0.50% on Monday .

Microsoft Corporation is one of the largest broad-based technology providers in the world . The company dominates the PC software market with more than 73% of the market share for desktop operating systems .  Microsoft reported revenues of $245.1 billion in fiscal 2024 . Productivity & Business Processes accounted for 31.7% of fiscal 2024 revenues . The company designs and sells PCs, tablets, gaming and entertainment consoles .  Microsoft closed its acquisition of Activision Blizzard on October 13, 2023 for $75.4 billion . More Personal Computing represented 25.3% of fiscal 2024 revenues .  $1000 investment made in May 2015 would be worth $9,629.47, or an 862.95% gain, as of May 21, 2025 . The S&P 500 rose 179.44% and the price of gold increased 162.41% over the same time frame in comparison .  Microsoft revenues benefited from stronger-than-expected performance in third-party and first-party content . However, higher operating expenses and spending on Azure amid stiff competition in the cloud space remain concerns . Over the past four weeks, shares have rallied 24.90% .

Microsoft-backed (MSFT) OpenAI's partner Crusoe has received $11.6 billion in new funding commitment . Crusoe is a partner of OpenAI and Crusoe, which aims to create a machine-like artificial intelligence .

Microsoft announced an international operation to disrupt Lumma Stealer, a variant of infostealing malware . Microsoft seized 2,300 domains that formed the backbone of Lumma’s infrastructure . The U.S. Department of Justice also seized the central command structure and disrupted online .  Lumma has played a role in some of the biggest infostealing operations in recent years . The main developer of Lumma is based in Russia and operates under the online name “Shamel” Microsoft observed Lumma being used in the attacks on Booking.com .  "Initial access brokering is big business and allows threat actors to harvest credentials at scale with minimal risk," says Palo Alto Networks' Unit 42 . Infostealers allow attackers to target less secure personal devices that have corporate credentials and tokens saved and cached .

Nvidia, Apple, and Microsoft are the three most valuable stocks in the world today . In five years, however, Amazon could overtake them due to the enormous opportunities it possesses in artificial intelligence . Amazon is already a massive company, and it, too, is worth a sizable amount .  Amazon plans to invest over $100 billion into data centers over the next decade . The company is rolling out Alexa+, an AI-powered version of its popular assistant . It invested billions into Anthropic, a key rival of ChatGPT . Amazon generated nearly $33 billion in free cash flow last year .  Microsoft Copilot has been underwhelming, with Salesforce's Marc Benioff often comparing it to Clippy from years past, which was a big disappointment . Amazon has plenty of growth potential ahead, but for it to catch up to the big three, it'll probably need them to stumble .  There's little reason to expect the company will be at the forefront of AI development in the future . Amazon was involved in AI well before ChatGPT made it a hot buzzword in the market . Nvidia's high-priced products may experience a slowdown .  Amazon is a topgrowth stockto own, and one that you can buy and forget about . With so many ways to still benefit from AI's growth, I wouldn't be surprised if it becomes the most valuable stock in the world in the next five years .  The Motley Fool recommends Advanced Micro Devices, Amazon, Apple, Microsoft, Nvidia, and Salesforce. another chance like this anytime soon. See the 3 stocks .

Lion Trust fund managers have questioned whether Microsoft’s significant investment in AI powerhouse OpenAI is enough to safeguard its dominance in software. The remarks starkly contrast the Buy rating by Goldman Sachs analysts, who have also hiked their price target to $550 from $480 .  Now According to Billionaires. Now According To Billionaires . Nvidia stock has taken some lumps this year, thanks to concerns around tariffs and export controls for China . Many of Nvidia's largest customers are continuing to spend billions on AI infrastructure . Nvidia stock is trading at a discount to its historical valuation, but that may soon change .  Nvidia stock is back at breakeven for the year as of mid-May, but for the remainder of 2025, Nvidia stock should soar . At one point, shares of Nvidia had dropped 30% year to date, resulting in amarket cap loss of nearly $1 trillion .  Longer-term, I'm quite confident in Nvidia's growth prospects . Microsoft,Amazon, and Alphabet have not lower their capital expenditure forecasts for this year .  Nvidia's dominant market share means the company is capturing a sizable chunk of that spending . The bullish narrative around this AI darling should recharge in the second half of the year .
